name: NBN's Bizarre Adventure
description:
It's a combo deck with multiple win conditions available.
1\ SanSan : Strangely enough, the deck doesn't use trace ice except a lone Data Raven. As soon as you have 8 credits and SanSan on table behind ETR ices, score profiteering for max profits. Rince and repeat for every agenda you get.

2\ Midseason/Beale/Psycho : Bad publicity will be of no use for the runner against trace events and this is why I chose Making News ID. Using money generators (Pop-up, Hedge Fund, GLC, Profiteering), the deck can quickly climb at 15-20 credits, making it possible to score a 4-5 AP Beale for victory.

3\ Midseason/SE/Archived Memories/PSF : Alternatively to scoring, SE/PSF can flatline the runner. Plascrete can nullify partially. If PSF is scored, focus on those and then SE the runner.

4\ Program destruction : Useful again noise and criminal. With Grim and Swordsman, the deck can create timing opportunities to score more agendas.

Additionnal Info : 1 Closed Accounts against tagme runners or after a bad Account Siphon. 1 Swodsman against Atman/Darwin/Crypsis. 45 Cards only to maximise probabilities.

name: Rush Noise
description:
I decided to cut extra situational cards like daily cast, stimhack to focus on what noise does the best, installing viruses.
Draws a lot, installing for free with 1-2 sahasraha, preferably on Djinn.
Money with Armitage for short term or Kati for long term.
Crypsis for code gates/sentries. Corroder for barriers.
Inside job when you need a little boost.
With Jackson, running archives often is needed, which is still OK for charging counters on Datasuckers.
The ID power should be enough to disturb the corporation plan.

name: Massive Chaos
description:
Cheat out the expensive stuff for cheap with Test Run, Eureka, and Retrieval Run for early aggression. Modded is best used on an early Opus, Gordian, or saved for surprise R&D Interfaces.

VoicePAD combos with almost the entire event suite. Test Run a Femme for free and Eureka it back for free on the next turn.

Femmes generally go on R&D (or anything too strong for Morning Star.) If the corp starts replacing ice just Scavenge them around as needed.

If the game is going long, drop a Toolbox and suddenly you have room for the full breaker suite plus 2 extra Femmes and an Opus.

I'd like to make room for Levy/Same Old Thing for emergencies. First drop candidates would probably be -1 Modded -1 Motivation.

name: HB: Brainfreeze
description:
Idea is to use Biotic to FA the Mandatory Upgrades and let it just spiral out of control (in a good way). Could switch some the Sentinels for Gila to have the potential for more Agendas scored out of hand.

I play this deck with the additional tactic of trying to "surprise" the runner with nasty ice when they don't expect it hit them for brain damage and threaten additional net damage once the Sentinels start to get scored.

name: Replicating Assets 1.0
description:
I would welcome feedback and suggestions for improvement of this deck!

The idea behind this deck is to discourage runs on remote servers - especially those providing economy. At least one remote server will be heavily defended, for advancing, as well as the central servers.

name: Dino Kit
description:
I would welcome feedback and suggestions for improving this deck.

The concept here is to have high link (as money source with professional contacts) and to use Yogasaurus, with various event cards, to hit R&D, and other servers as appropriate.

I've had some success with an earlier version of this deck in Octgn. I've thrown in Plascrete for general protection against nuking. Not sure how necessary this is.

Thoughts?

name: NBN NA Rush - Shipment from SanSan
description:
I'm winning games left and right with this one.

As a lot of you are probably aware, the top 16 at worlds was dominated by NBN rush/Never Advance decks. I've been running with this archetype for a long time, so I loved seeing it doing so well at worlds.

This deck is always a threat, regardless of your credit count. With a single credit, you can score astroscript or beale from unadvanced. With an astroscript counter, you can score a 3/2 with zero credits. With a sansan, you can score almost anything in the deck for the cost of a single shipment. Breaking news from hand cold with zero credits, which won me a game by itself.

Sure, it only 'nets' you two credits, but thats only part of the story. Its going to be compared to beanstalk, so let me stamp that out now - its not the same card at all. If you are on 1 or less credits with an agenda in hand, beanstalk doesnt help if you draw it - you're still waiting a turn to score.

This archetype pushes out one agenda on turn 1 or 2. It has to. Its amazing if doing that doesnt bankrupt you.

To my surprise, EVERY time i drew shipment i was glad to see it. You generally score 4 or 5 agendas a game (maybe 6 if you rez archer as well), so if you're in a game state where you cant threaten to score, you are missing the point of the deck.

More testing needs to be done - only got 3 games in - but i think Shipment from SanSan is a hidden gem for this archetype.

name: McCaffrazade
description: A simple deck designed around Scheherazade. It involves a lot of program recursion. A lot.

name: Edge of the Design
description: I love Minelayer. It saves the deck so many credits.
